newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Bakrie mulls listing telcom, other units.
newsitem.headline: Bakrie mulls listing telcom, other units.

text.p: Indonesian conglomerate PT Bakrie & Brothers is mulling the possibility of listing its infrastructure, chemical and telecommunications units in 1998, company officials said.
"Our consultant, Salomon Brothers, is now studying the plan. We hope we would be able to list our infrastructure, chemical and telecommunications units next year," chairman Aburizal Bakrie said.
Bakrie said the listing of the units could provide added value for its shareholders and for the company as well.
Bakrie's agrobusiness unit PT Bakrie Sumatra Plantations is already listed on the Jakarta stock exchange.
"Now if someone is interested in the firm's telecommunications business, but is not interested in the firm's other core business, he cannot do it (invest)," Bakrie said.
Bakrie did not give further details.
